chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Gene Luckas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andrew Gene Luckas is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andrew Gene Luckas was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Andrew Gene Luckas was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Andrew Gene Luckas was found guilty of Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Gene Luckas

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
8:23 AM Defendant Andrew Gene Luckas in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Rosenthal in court for Andrew Gene Luckas.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF181, 22CT54, 22CT55, 22TR864, and 22TR1390. State indicates agreement. Defendant will plead to counts 1, 4 and 5 in 22CF181 and will plead to sole count in 22CT55. In 22CF181, count 1: 270 days jail imposed and stayed for 3 years of probation. 120 days conditional jail with 64 days credit, fine of $3,391 fine plus costs, IID, driver's safety plan and assessment, and 36 month license revocation. Counts 4 and 5  - costs only. In 22CT55, $100 fine plus costs. State moves to dismiss 22CT44, 22TR864, and 22TR1390. 
Defendant pleads no contest to counts 1, 4, and 5 in 22CF181 and pleads no contest to sole count in 22CT55. State has complied with victim's rights. Attorney Rosenthal stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the defendant's pleas and finds that the pleas have knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds the defendant guilty and judgment of conviction is entered. Court dismisses 22CT44, 22TR864, and 22TR1390. State makes statement, reviews defendant's criminal history and indicates defendant has pending criminal charges in MN. Has been accepted to drug court in MN. State has complied with victim rights, victim would like to see the defendant get help and be rehabilitated. Attorney Rosenthal makes statement. Defendant makes statement. 

Court orders in 22CF181, count 1 - 270 days jail imposed and stayed for 3 years of probation. 120 days conditional jail with 64 days credit, fine of $3,391 fine inclusive, DOC programming, 36 month IID, driver's safety plan and assessment, and 36 month license revocation. Count 4 - court costs. Count 5 $300 fine plus costs. Court orders in 22CT55, $100 fine plus costs. 120 days to pay balances.

records.addlTxt:
10:28 AM Defendant Andrew Gene Luckas in court, in custody. Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Andrew Gene Luckas.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rosenthal states close to resolution but need to work out a few details. Asks for status in a couple weeks and will be set for sentencing at that time. State in agreement. Court sets status conference/potential sentencing.
Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:12 PM Defendant Andrew Gene Luckas appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Andrew Gene Luckas.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Court accepts plea.
Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

9:08 AM Defendant Andrew Gene Luckas in court in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Andrew Gene Luckas.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Andrew Gene Luckas
Current: 411 N 58th Ave W, Duluth, MN 55807 United States  (Effective: 05-24-2022)
Prior: 2007 N 27Th St, Superior, WI 54880
No use or possession of alcohol. No frequenting establishments that serve alcohol. No driving.

3:13 PM Defendant Andrew Gene Luckas appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan Reid appears in court on behalf of the defendant. Attorney Reed gives a current address for the defendant. Court inquires about Victim ID Key. State identifies victim (JK). Attorney Reid indicates receipt of the complaint and enters not guilty pleas to misdemeanor counts. State asks for $4,500 cash bail with conditions of no use or possession of alcohol, no frequenting establishments that serve alcohol, and no driving. State notes that he has appeared to most of his court appearances with a few FTA, but has acquired 13 OAR charges within the last 10 years. State has concerns over defendant's ability to follow court orders and notes pending charges in MN and indicates the defendant is also currently on probation in MN. Asks for high cash to ensure appearances. Attorney Reid asks for a cash bail of up to $750. Indicates that the defendant has lived in Douglas County most of his life and has employment and family that will ensure his appearance. Notes that there are a few FTAs, but has made most appearances. Notes that the defendant is in out patient treatment and on supervision in MN which will aid in ensuring the defendant's appearance at future court appearances. Court notes concerns over ability to follow court orders and bail jumping charges. Court orders $2,000 cash with conditions of no use or possession of alcohol, no frequenting establishments that serve alcohol and no driving. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
